system: You are a helpful assistant on Ú.
response: Ú, ú (u-acute) is a Latin letter used in the Czech, Dobrujan Tatar, Faroese, Hungarian, Icelandic, Karakalpak and Slovak writing systems. This letter also appears in Dutch, Frisian, Irish, Occitan, Catalan, Pinyin, Portuguese, Spanish, Italian, Galician, and Vietnamese as a variant of the letter "U". <LINK>(https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/%C3%9A)

system: You are a helpful assistant on Ú.
You are a helpful assistant on Ú.
response: Ú/ú is the 34th letter of the Czech alphabet and represents a /uː/ sound. It is always the first letter of the word except in compound words, such as "trojúhelník" triangle, which is composed of two words: "troj", which is derived from "tři" three, and "úhel", which means angle. If this sound is in the middle of the word, the letter Ů is used instead. <LINK>(https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/%C3%9A)

system: You are a helpful assistant on Ú.
response: Ú/ú is the 28th letter of Dobrujan Tatar alphabet, represents the hight rounded half-advanced ATR or soft vowel /ʉ/ as in "sút" [s̶ʉt̶] 'milk'. In the vicinity of semivowel y, which occurs rarely, its articulation shifts to high rounded ATR or soft /y/, close to Turkish pronunciation, as in "súymek" [s̶ym̶ec] 'to love'. <LINK>(https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/%C3%9A)

system: You are a helpful assistant on Ú.
response: Ú/ú is the 24th letter of the Faroese alphabet, and may represent the following sounds: Short [ʏ] in such words as krúss [kɹʏsː] ("mug", "coffee cup") Short [ɪ] before /ɡv/ in such words as kúgv [kɪɡv] ("cow"), but also in brúdleyp [bɹɪdlɛip] ("bridal") Long [ʉu] diphthong in úti [ʉuːtɪ] ("out"), hús [hʉuːs] ("house"), jú [jʉuː] ("but"), <LINK>(https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/%C3%9A)

system: You are a helpful assistant on Ú.
response: Ú/ú is the 36th letter of the Hungarian alphabet and represents a /uː/ sound. <LINK>(https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/%C3%9A)

system: You are a helpful assistant on Ú.
response: Ú/ú is the 25th letter of the Icelandic alphabet, and represents a /u/ sound. <LINK>(https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/%C3%9A)

system: You are a helpful assistant on Ú.
response: Ú/ú is the letter of the Javanese Latin alphabet, and represents a /ʊ/ sound <LINK>(https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/%C3%9A)

system: You are a helpful assistant on Ú.
response: It was proposed in 2018 that Ú/ú should be one of its Latin script, it should represent the near-close front rounded vowel (ʏ) and is used to replace Cyrillic Ү. The replacement is modified to be Ü ü in 2020. <LINK>(https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/%C3%9A)

system: You are a helpful assistant on Ú.
response: Ú/ú is the 26th letter of the Karakalpak alphabet and represents near-close front rounded vowel. <LINK>(https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/%C3%9A)

system: You are a helpful assistant on Ú.
response: Ú/ú is the 39th letter of the Slovak alphabet and represents a /uː/ sound. <LINK>(https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/%C3%9A)

system: You are a helpful assistant on Ú.
response: In Portuguese, Galician, Spanish and Catalan, "ú" is not a distinct letter but a modified letter "u". It is used to denote an "u" with unusual stress. <LINK>(https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/%C3%9A)

system: You are a helpful assistant on Ú.
response: Ú/ú is a variant of U carrying an acute accent; it represents an /u/ carrying the tonic accent. It is used only if it is the last letter of the word except in dictionaries. <LINK>(https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/%C3%9A)
